data.text:
@discodeb2000 @Tireddadruns The "collect the race number the day before" thing is what made me give up.

I live in Portsmouth and driving to Brighton to pick it up the day before is a complete nonsense.

@montythemole @Tireddadruns Plenty of events going similar now, and will probably continue. The 'new normal ' we'll be told, as we don't get that banana (@CoastHalf) or they can't post our race numbers (@marathonbcm)- none of them even closely related to Covid spread 🤡
@montythemole I think they'll follow, not only does it save money it makes people spend more time at the expo as well so more likely to spend money. 💰
@Tireddadruns Wondering if London will keep the same system as well?

@Tireddadruns Exactly! I always entered at the expo to make it a ‘a bit cheaper’. I could never quite understand why it’s more expensive than London 🤔 They certainly don’t have as many toilets at the start ….

@discodeb2000 The fact they allowed the race packs to be sent in the post to members was the last straw for me. Also that they will no longer do the "cheap" £45 entry on the race weekend anymore for the following year.

@Tireddadruns What a unnecessary faff! I gave up on them when they introduced the bizarre membership option 2 years ago. Yes, I ran the first 10 races, but why would I want to pay upfront to run the next 3 or 5?

@RobH_GOAT I've done it 3 times as I used to live right on the start line. I'm only doing it this year as I had an old entry I deffered to this year. It has got worse and worse, and my first time was when they ran out of water. They rely on the amazing crowds to keep People coming.

@Tireddadruns I think Brighton's going to end up being a one and done for me. The whole bib pick up and now the no on the day drop, just so much hassle and inconvenience for a marathon.

Doesn't seem like they have any justifiable reasons for these methods...
@SportsMassageEP It was always going to stay this way, I'm surprised they haven't started charging for bag drops yet.
